cognates: Italian sfacciare (but which has a different meaning)
efaciar.meaning: Of something impressed or inscribed upon a surface, to cause to disappear by rubbing out, striking out, etc.; to erase; to render illegible or indiscernible.
efaciar.signification: De alquo impresset o inscrit sur un superficie, causar desaparir per friction, trastrecation, etc.; eraser; causar esser ínleibil o indiscernibil.
efaciar.notes: Stronger and more forceful than [[eraser]], appropriate for both literal and nonliteral meanings, note the negative [[de]]

efaruchar.meaning: To scare off or frighten away (an animal), figuratively, to alarm or shock a person.
